#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Montreal/Parc Jean-Drapeau
#Text=Parc Jean-Drapeau is a district in Montreal .
#Text=It is comprised of the islands Île Sainte-Helene and Île Notre-Dame in the Saint Lawrence river .
#Text=By metro
#Text=The Yellow Line runs from Berri-UQAM in Downtown to metro Jean-Drapeau , on Ile Notre Dame , just next to the Biosphere .
#Text=By ferry
#Text=Seasonal ferries run from the Old Port .
#Text=By bus
#Text=The seasonal 769 La Ronde shuttle connects Papineau metro station to La Ronde amusement park
#Text=By car
#Text=Access the island from Pont Jacques-Cartier at the north end of Île Sainte-Helene or pass by Habitat 67 and use Pont Condorde to the south .
#Text=Parking is limited and expensive , running $ 10 - 15 flat rate depending on the season and events .
#Text=Note that car access to and around the islands is cut off during Formula One races ( obviously , since the road around Ile Notre Dame doubles as the race track ) and other events .
#Text=By foot
#Text=There are a number of footpaths throughout the park , on both islands .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Two bus routes run from main terminal a few meters from the metro station : 767 La Ronde / La Plage to La Ronde amusement park and the beach , and 777 Le Casino to the casino .
#Text=See
#Text=Montreal Biosphère , 160 Chemin Tour-de-l'Isle , ☏ +1514 283-5000 , toll-free : +1-855-773-8200 , ✉ info.biosphere@ec.gc.ca .
#Text=Jun 1-Sep 6 10AM-5PM daily , Sep 7-May 31 Th - Su 10AM-5PM .
#Text=The former United States pavilion from Expo 67 , a geodesic dome designed by R. Buckminster Fuller .
#Text=It now houses an Environment Canada museum dedicated to water and the environment .
#Text=$ 15 adult / $ 12 senior / $ 10 student ( 18+ ) / free for youth ( 0-17 ) .
#Text=Habitat 67 , 2600 avenue Pierre-Dupuy ( take Chemin du Moulins exit from Hwy 10 south ) , ☏ +1 514-866-5971 .
#Text=This visually striking residential building was created by architect Moshe Safdie for Expo 67 .
#Text=The result was an amazingly modern dwelling that challenged the way architects created urban homes .
#Text=Compared alternately to a beehive , a Taos pueblo , and a crystalline growth , the complex 's 154 units are composed of prefabricated concrete cubes assembled on site .
#Text=The apartments here are highly prized and a number of prominent Montrealers make Habitat 67 their home .
#Text=Formula 1 Grand Prix ( Circuit Gilles Villeneuve ) , 2170 Pierre-Dupuy Avenue , office 100 , ☏ +1 514-350-0000 , fax : +1 514-350-0007 , ✉ dfauteux@octanemanagement.ca .
#Text=The Canadian Grand Prix is a must-see for any petrolhead or sports fan .
#Text=The annual event , taking place on Île Notre-Dame , attracts up to 100,000 people , and spans an entire weekend , with practice and qualifying on Friday and Saturday and the race on Sunday .
#Text=Weekend admission is $ 126 , and grandstand seats are upwards of $ 267 .
#Text=Wheelchair accessible seats are available at a lower price .
#Text=Musée Stewart ( Stewart Museum ) , 20 Chemin du Tour de l'isle Montréal , ☏ +1514 861-6701 .
#Text=Tu - Su 10AM-5PM .
#Text=$ 10 general admission , $ 8 senior/student , free for children .
#Text=Do
#Text=Montreal Casino ( Casino de Montréal ) , 1 Avenue du Casino , ☏ +1 514-392-2746 .
#Text=24 hours daily .
#Text=Opened in 1993 , this is the largest casino in Canada .
#Text=Open to visitors aged 18 or older .
#Text=Public pool ( Complexe aquatique de l'île Sainte-Hélène ) .
#Text=Open daily 16 Jun-24 Aug
#Text=11AM-4PM , Weekends 25 Aug-14 Sep .
#Text=Beach park , ☏ +1514 872-6120 .
#Text=20 Jun-24 Aug , 10AM-7PM. .
#Text=Clean water and sand attracts families to this small , man-made beach at the south tip of Ile Notre Dame .
#Text=Activities include a playground , volleyball , and watercraft rentals .
#Text=There are bathrooms , changing rooms , and a snack bar .
#Text=Ages 14 and up $ 8 , 6-13 $ 4 , 65+ $ 7 , Family $ 20 .
#Text=Season passes available .
#Text=Dragon Boats .
#Text=Rowing .
#Text=Waterskiing and wakeboarding ( L'école provinciale de ski nautique ) .
#Text=Île Notre-Dame lake and at the Olympic Basin . , ☏ +1 514-592-6552 .
#Text=Summer .
#Text=$35/hr .
#Text=Reservations required .
#Text=La Ronde .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Picnicking is the most common form of dining on the islands , but there are a few snack bars scattered around ( open Jun-Sep ) .
#Text=For sit-down dining , head to the Casino on Ile Ste-Helen .
#Text=Budget
#Text=Snack Bar Espace-Bouffe ( métro Île Ste-Hélène , just outside Jean-Drapeau metro ) .
#Text=8AM-8PM .
#Text=Basic chips-and-hot-dog snack bar .
#Text=$ 1 and up .
#Text=Mid-range
#Text=La Bonne Carte , 1 avenue du Casino ( located in the Casino , third floor ) .
#Text=Lunch Mon - Fri 11AM-2:30PM , Dinner Sun-Thu 4:30PM-closing , Brunch Sat 11AM-2:30PM Sun 11AM-3:30PM .
#Text=Lunch , dinner , and weekend brunch are offered at the Casino buffet .
#Text=Brunch $ 19.95 , Lunch $ 15.95 , Dinner $ 25.95 .
#Text=Splurge
#Text=Nuances , 1 avenue du Casino ( located in the Casino , top floor ) , ☏ +1 514-392-2708 .
#Text=Open Sun-Thu 5:30PM-11PM , Fri - Sat 5:30PM-11:30PM .
#Text=French haute cuisine with a Quebec edge served far removed from the noise of the casino .
#Text=Choose between lobster , Quebec lamb , loin of deer , and other season specialties or try the chefs " discovery menu " .
#Text=Note , no exceptions are made to the Casinos : strict 18 & up policy .
#Text=Mains $40-$ 45 .
#Text=Festin du Gouverneur ( in the Stewart Museum ) , ☏ +1 514-879-1141 .
#Text=Apr-Oct 6PM and 8:30PM ; 1 Nov-31 Mar , 6PM ; Dec Sun-Thu 7PM and Fri - Sat 6:30PM and 8:30PM .
#Text=Set menu ( meat , fish , and veggie options ) with historical reenactment show .
#Text=$ 50 adults/$ 25 under 12 .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=There are no hotels on the islands , and you will therefore have to cross the Saint Lawrence river to find somewhere to sleep .
#Text=The closest place to look would be Old Montreal or South West Montreal west of the islands , or Saint-Lambert east of the islands .
#Text=But given the fact that Montreal Casino is open 24 hours daily , why would you want to sleep ?
